content.description: A spring is attached to a block at rest on a horizontal surface. The block-spring system is in equilibrium when the block is at position <math alttext="x equals 0" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn></math> as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. The block is then pushed to the left, so that the spring is compressed a distance <math alttext="x equals 0.5 meter" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.5</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">m</mi></math> as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. The block is released from rest and allowed to oscillate in simple harmonic motion. While oscillating, the maximum speed of the cart is <math alttext="v sub maximum" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>v</mi> <mi>max</mi> </msub> </math>.
